rules.summary: The T allele at rs1799853 (CYP2C9*2) is associated with reduced CYP2C9 enzyme activity in clinical guidelines.
CC at rs1799853 is not associated with the reduced-function CYP2C9*2 allele.
The A allele at rs1057910 (CYP2C9*3) is associated with reduced CYP2C9 enzyme activity in clinical guidelines.
CC at rs1057910 is not associated with the reduced-function CYP2C9*3 allele.
The T allele at rs9923231 in VKORC1 is associated with increased warfarin sensitivity in clinical guidelines.
CC at rs9923231 is not associated with the increased sensitivity reported for the T allele.

default_summary: No call or unrecognized genotype for CYP2C9/VKORC1 markers.
suggestion: If you take warfarin, discuss pharmacogenomic testing with a clinician. Do not change medications based on this app.

evidence_level.summary: CPIC guidelines exist for CYP2C9/VKORC1 and warfarin.

limitations: Full warfarin guidance requires clinical-grade genotyping and clinical factors. This is not dosing advice.
references: CPIC guidelines for CYP2C9/VKORC1 and warfarin (PharmGKB/CPIC)
